subject: Re: Difference between new 12-470 and old one? ~ Margaret
author: lunalamia
full_text:
I am going to go check them out again, to make sure they are the old 
ones, absolutely.  They are grey and white, I know that much, and 
they are 12-470....so I'll check next week. If they are, I will buy 
them both, even if for someone else to give away for the cost only.
Laura

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@...> 
wrote:
>
> Hi Laura.  I would recommend you buy BOTH of the old 12-470's, as 
those units are very 
> hard to come by.  I'm sure someone would be happy to buy the second 
one from you, and 
> you can make use of the first.  If you don't like it, you can sell 
it too. 
> 
> I've not tried the 20-125 or the 12-820, so someone else will have 
to give you feedback 
> about how they all compare.  The one that really stands out (in not 
a good way) from the 
> other hackables is the new 12-469.  It has an annoying click-click-
clicking, which some 
> can easily tune out and others cannot.  I have it, as well as the 
old version 12-469, and old 
> 12-470.
> 
> For manual radio sweep (turning the dial back and forth yourself), 
I like to use the Duracell 
> KP028.  It comes in a 2-pack for around $30, including shipping 
from places like Amazon 
> and eBay.  You might be able to find them in a local store.  I got 
mine from Costco.  Not 
> sure if they have those in your area or not.  I've had better 
results with this unit than I have 
> any of the shack hacks, though I still find the hacks fun to play 
with.  
> 
> Others feel they have had better results with the hacks as compared 
to manual sweep.  Not 
> sure if it has to do with the model of radio they are using or 
not.  I have tried multiple 
> manual sweep units, and that is how I came to like the Duracell as 
my favorite so far.  I 
> also like the Durapro emergency radio, but the thumb dial gives me 
blisters!
> 
> I guess it's just like digital recorders ... one person can get 
great EVP with a certain make 
> and model, while another person will get nothing with it.  LOL - 
for me, the Olympus I 
> have seems to be like that.  I've never had much luck with it.
> 
> OK, time for me to hit the sack.  
> 
> Margaret
